intro: Malva thuringiaca subsp. thuringiaca, commonly known as the common mallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It features heart-shaped leaves with a soft, fuzzy texture and produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to ecological gardens.
